comments.body: This is a really cool idea! I hope it gets added! What would the bubble fish drop when killed?
I like the idea of the Redcap! I can also imagine it could drop a very valuable item that can only be obtained from him!
They do this already though, at least on Java.
Cool I live in Australia so we don’t have gophers. That would be really cool. They would be bred with any vegetable or seed.
i like it but it would be really frikin annoying

"i like it but it would be really frikin annoying".
I know. Right? :D Perfect.

So, like creeper ruining your build annoying? Or Villager stuck in a hole annoying? ;)
how about (steve) was bitten by phantom? just a suggestion.

In addition to “[Player] lost their grip on reality.”, I think if a player was killed by a phantom after receiving damage from another source, it should be “[Player] lost their grip on reality imagining [Other Damage Source].”

I think they are not immune to fire because they originally came threw the ruined portals. They partially adapted to the nether but have not evolved to the point of fire resistance. That is why they have potions of fire resistance that they might give you for gold.
maybe the brutes could be immune to fire and lava but not soul fire and hoglins and piglins are just immune to fire

Maybe instead like witches, they drink fire resistance potions while in lava or throw splash potions at hoglins, and other piglins while in lava. Brutes automatically should be immune to fire and lava.
I all ways wanted a pet creeper
Why?
YES PLEASE
That would be super cool, but I was thinking it should only spawn in hard and normal mode.
How would it look like? Also, doesn't that mean the largest slime can one-shot a player without armor?

It would be a see-through darkpurple color, with a darker core/center (core is not see-through). Its eyes would either be a pink or red color.
Even though it would be capable of killing players without armor, no player would logically go to the end without any armor equipped. It would still pose as a threat, though. Hope this answered your question.
Ah so like a slime and a magma cube but for the end
Maybe make a new golden axe texture exclusive for them.
That would be nice... I assume it is similar to horse armor? Btw you can search up my posts at Fresh894 more fighting mechanics
yes, because we already dont murder thousands of bred cows, pigs, sheep, and chicken every minecraft day.

How about making adult turtles despawn if they haven't bred, similar to hoglins, so that baby turtles grow up before despawning. Of course turtles that spawn with world generation won't despawn. This would be nice because killing turtles is tedious and only drops seagrass.
@SwissGrater -Those mobs were designed to be killed for resources. Turtles were designed to be protected, and there's no benefit to killing them--only letting them grow into adults.
This needs more attention. I gotta kill baby turtles so I don't lag out the game due to too many entities.

i just wish they dropped more scutes and turtle meat, maybe turtle shell knee pads/shoulder pads or somthing. dropping seaweed is fair but id like more with the scutes and shells. seems their only purpose is growing up. i love the life they add to the oceans, i got 80 turtles but the scutes despawn too fast or somthing cause i only got about half that right now.
A better solution would be to limit turtle breeding if too many of them are in one chunk... Maybe 10 per chunk is a good limit

I would agree that turtles seem more like a plague than a rare and interesting game mechanic. It seems like beach quickly becomes busy with constant turtle activity. In the fight to control lag it would be nice to tweak turtle spawning to be more rare.
No i love killing them but i dont like pacifism

Its a sandbox game not freaking science class

Also if you have a problem with this why not the fact that the piglins will starve without the meat from the hogs

It is the nether it is meant to be hell like having to eat your evolutional source isnt to unlikely
....why....why must you ruin the piglin AI....

You want to be super scientific, go ahead,

 

Pigs IRL are omnivores yes, but are known for cannabalizing its perfectly logical that the pigs would eat other pig related animals because pigs eat pretty much anything

of which their are 3 food sources in the nether

warped fungus (striders eat those)

the red shroom (i forgot what their called but hoglins eat those)

Raw pork ( taken from killed hoglins, consumed by piglins, players, and tamed wolves
Yes! That would be epic if dogs could hold weapons and defend themselves

This taken too far (see comment above) would remove from the uniqueness of foxes. Animals should eat their food items, but not render them. Cows are an exception because they actually chew their food for a long time. Wolves should be able to pick up and bury sticks and bones, which would add to their realism, but ONLY sticks and bones because otherwise, it would detract from the uniqueness and special place of the fox. Also, wolves would not actually do that, whereas foxes might.
I think his is a good idea and I would like to see more information about this mob.
Nice idea! The only thing that I think is a bit powerful is the 1 minute nausea and poison effect. Maybe 30 seconds for both effects? More than that is too much I think.
The fact that there is already a skin for swamp villagers ingame hints that they may add regular swamp villages at some point so I don't think there is any need for unique swamp villager-like mob

Hello, it has been almost a year since I posted this, so... I’m here to update it!

So, now, if you were to hit a Riblin, they all would retaliate. They would live in a swampy village with big mushrooms around (maybe a new type, I dunno, they could maybe glow???) and it would be similar to a village. Normal Riblins could trade for swampy items, and every few days, some of their trades can change. There would be no trading “tiers” for them. There could be Riblin Warriors in the community, fighting off Witches and such. Dirty Emeralds would be made with an Emerald in the center, and dirt ALL around, for one Dirty Emerald. The Riblin Tongue would only give the effects for 30 seconds, instead of one whole minute! Also, there could be a few more things, such as a Frog, it can swim, and it can go on land, but it starts dying if it is too far from water for too long. A new block could be the Mud Block. You would craft 8 of them with a Water Bucket in the middle, and Dirt Blocks all around. You would get the Bucket back. You could then craft a Mud Block into 6 Mud Puddles. Those would be kinda like Top Snow. So they could be layered. And, to craft them back into a Mud Block, you could put 6 Mud Puddles back into the Crafting Table to make 1 Mud Block. And, better yet, you could use a bucket on a Mud Block to consume the mud, and get a Bucket of Mud. You could then use this on a Frog to scoop it up! You could then later place it and the mud back down, of course! -The Creeper 556
That would be pretty cool, I think the scelatal versions should have black bones like wither skeletons. And that way it would be epic for either sceletons to ride the hoglins
That's not a bad idea. There could be another suggestion for Wither Piglins and Hoglins. There should be some way to transform a Skeletal Piglin or Hoglin into its Wither variant.

I feel that that would be slightly overpowered and that there are plenty of shulkers in a single player world for one person. If they were renewable then they wouldn’t be balanced and they’d become too op.

I am not sure if the ender dragon kill is the right trigger, but I agree that some sort of re spawning of shulkers would be really great. Sure getting the first x shulker boxes is exciting, but after that it becomes boring / tiring and grindy.

1. Why do beatles belong to the end?

2. Dropping Elytra's is way to OP.
Just no
Whats the point? How does this fit in with the end?

I love the idea!! Elytra are from beetles after all.. however, I think the Shulkers have the End City covered and having them peaceful causes game balancing issues. Personally I would like to see them be as rare as Mooshrooms, spawning in "burrows" underneath the Endstone Islands. They could be a Neutral Mob (like Zombie Piglins) that could be farmed in some way. If attacked they would attempt to lift you high in the air, randomly dropping you to your death. You would need to look up to kill it while it's lifting you up making using a water bucket to brake your fall very difficult. And Bane of Arthropods would super effective against them.
They should be able to hold up to 4 tropical fish and go into buckets and cauldrons.
This would be good but I feel like it's a lil bit too much to make them tamable and maybe you can make so they spawn on beaches.
I prefer the regular Tropical Slime, this idea is too complicated and changes this mob too much.
I don't think they should be able to pick up any of this biome's blocks at all, even shroomlights or gold. However, I like the basic idea of this.
It's so unfun having to clean up the outside of my Nether house every 10 minutes. Really hoping they change this
They block my nether roads and just make the scenary ugly

Endermen a long time ago could pick up anything but they needed to be scaled back. I just do not understand exactly why we need to scale them back a second time. I understand you though. You are right we should do SOMETHING to stop this problem. The whole point of minecraft is to be creative but what fun is it if something keeps messing in up.
like a pig gets attracted to a carrot in an item frame
I like this
OOookaaay!

I like it! I think the cake part makes more sense than the cookie part, but still cool! Advanced players would make cakes to boost their enderman farms, giving the cake block a reason to be crafted. I also just love the fact that endermen are so huge and imposing and scary and dangerous, the embodiment of the void itself...

But the void itself likes cake gosh darnit!
maybe warped and crimson rods
